context: In 2020, Monday.com was establishing itself as a Work OS platform, competing in the work management and project management space. The company was operating pre-IPO (went public in June 2021) and building market share against established players in collaborative work management, visual project tracking, and team productivity tools.

competitors.name: Asana
competitors.notes: Work management platform with tasks, projects, timelines, and portfolios for clean task tracking. Strong competitor for marketing teams prioritizing task management and collaboration over visual customization.

competitors.name: Trello
competitors.notes: Visual project management tool specializing in the Kanban method with boards, lists, and cards. Particularly user-friendly for small teams wanting visual simplicity without complexity.

competitors.name: Wrike
competitors.notes: Enterprise work management platform with projects, tasks, proofing, and reporting for complex workflows. Strong for large marketing teams and enterprises needing advanced permissions and robust reporting.

competitors.name: Smartsheet
competitors.notes: Spreadsheet-based project management platform with built-in templates. Appeals to users familiar with Excel/Google Sheets, offering team collaboration tools and workflow automation.

competitors.name: ClickUp
competitors.notes: Productivity platform with tasks, docs, wikis, goals, and dashboards for highly customizable project management. Offers extreme flexibility for power users and large teams.

competitors.name: Teamwork
competitors.notes: Comprehensive task and project management platform offering vast range of features and strong customer support including phone-based support on all plans.

competitors.name: Jira
competitors.notes: Agile project management software with scrum boards, Kanban boards, and customizable dashboards. Particularly strong for software development teams tracking projects in real-time.

competitors.name: Airtable
competitors.notes: Spreadsheet and database hybrid with project management features, ideal for data-intensive projects and general information management.

competitors.name: Notion
competitors.notes: Hybrid platform combining document, wiki, and project management features, offering versatility beyond traditional project management tools.

competitors.name: Microsoft Project
competitors.notes: Traditional project management software for teams relying heavily on Microsoft ecosystem, designed to help complete complex projects with enterprise-grade features.
